1responsibility;frákannasær alla ábyrgddisclaim responsibility for it, wash one's hands of it;eg frákanni mær alla ábyrgdI refuse to accept any responsibility, I wash my hands of the matter;gera ábyrgd galdandimóti e-m fyri e-thold sby responsible for sth;leggja ábyrgdina á hannplace the responsibility on his shoulders, throw the responsibility on him; blame him for it;hannhevurábyrgdina av tíhe is responsible for it, the responsibility is his;ábyrgdinhvílirá honumthe responsibility rests with him;ábyrgdliggur á(t.d., responsibility for the Faroese economic policy resides with the Faroese government);taka áseg ábyrgdina av e-mtake(el.shoulder) the responsibility for sth; claim responsibility for;taka á seg sín part av ábyrgdinishare the responsibility, shoulder one's share of the responsibility;eintungábyrgda heavy responsibility;frælsiundirábyrgd[freedom with responsibility]; (samsvarandi ensk orðing er:) freedom subject to the consequences of the law;virka undir ábyrgdbe prepared to accept the responsibility for one's actions; be accountable for one's actions;við ongariábyrgd fyri okkumwithout responsibility on our part2(viðv.endurgjaldskravi) liability,avmarkaðábyrgdlimited liability;gera ábyrgdgaldandimóti e-m fyri e-t(krevja endurgjald) hold sby liable in damages for sth, claim damages from sby;(trygg.) ábyrgdsambærtlóginilegal responsibility, third party liability, public liability;sáttmálabundinábyrgdcontractual liability3(umt.d.politikara) responsibility, liability, accountability(t.d.a Minister's accountability to Parliament)4(skyld) blame(t.d.the blame for it lies at his door(el.rests with him))5(løgfr.)(kautión) surety6(løgfr.)guarantee, guaranty,(serl. í samb. v.lán) security;(am. eis.)collateral;
